author: Staff Reporter
text:
Bike-taxi operators who ignored the Karnataka Transport Department’s stern warnings got a rude shock on Friday. In a massive undercover operation with check-posts and squads posted in several neighbourhoods, officials seized 62 bike-taxis operated by Uber.

It was a carefully planned sting operation: Officials roped in 30 volunteers, all private citizens, to book bike-taxis. Once the booking was made and the rider reached the pick-up location, officials seized the two-wheeler and the app booking device. This has come as a blow to Uber, which had announced bike-taxi services in Bengaluru around 10 days after it had introduced it for the first time in Bangkok.

“If more such bike-taxis are operating in the city, they will be seized and the app devices will be confiscated,” a statement from the Transport Commissioner said.

But despite the warnings, The Hindu found that the service was still available in some parts of the city on Friday evening.

Bike-taxis are being termed illegal because they are private vehicles with white board registration plates being used for commercial purposes.
title: 62 Uber bike-taxis seized in Bengaluru
